channel.description: Recent content in marginal structural models on Functional Statistics

item.title: Permutation Weighting for Estimating Marginal Structural Model Parameters
item.description: A few weeks ago, I demonstrated how permutation weighting (Arbour, Dimmery, and Sondhi 2020) can be used to estimate causal parameters under interference. Today, I show how to use the same idea to estimate parameters in a longitudinal marginal structural model (MSM) (Robins 1999; Robins, Hern√°n, and Brumback 2000). This post is mostly me proving to myself that it works when combining interference with longitudinal data in a MSM.
